Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and illustrate different habitats, including at least one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can draw and label various plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or bushes.
The student can draw and label different animals found in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants for land, and fish, clams for water.
The student can use their drawings to show the different patterns of plant and animal diversity in each habitat.
The student can organize their drawing to compare the different types of living things found in different habitats.
